title: Verify the MESSAGE_BODY in data_bus_message table while creating patron via PV
custom_steps:
1. Login to PVNG
Expected Result:
User should be able to login to application successfully
2. Go to Patron Management and create a new patron
Expected Result:
Patron should be created successfully
3. Run the below query and verify the MESSAGE_BODY
select * from PVQAF02.data_bus_message where data_bus_message_sub_type_code in ('PBT', 'PI', 'PM') order by created_date desc;
Expected Result:
MESSAGE_BODY starts with FORM_CODE, and that the clientId=XXX comes after the ADAPTER_CODE name/value pair.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PVNG
2. Go to Patron Management and create a new patron
3. Run the below query and verify the MESSAGE_BODY
select * from PVQAF02.data_bus_message where data_bus_message_sub_type_code in ('PBT', 'PI', 'PM') order by created_date desc;
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User should be able to login to application successfully
2. Patron should be created successfully
3. MESSAGE_BODY starts with FORM_CODE, and that the clientId=XXX comes after the ADAPTER_CODE name/value pair.

title: Verify PVO XML error message when an External ID already in use for another account within the same organizational scope is not as expected
custom_preconds: Set "enhanced.identity.features.enabled" to FALSE
custom_steps:
1. Create a new patron via MaintainPatron request-Patron should be created successfully
Expected Result:
The patron should be created
2. Now, create another patron with the same External ID as the previously created patron

Expected Result:
The patron should be created
3. Verify the error message
Expected Result:
*PATRON_ACCOUNT_IDENTITY_PROVIDER_EXTERNAL_ID_ALREADY_EXISTS**The patron account cannot be created because the account identity provider external ID for the patron account already exists.*

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Create a new patron via MaintainPatron request-Patron should be created successfully
2. Now, create another patron with the same External ID as the previously created patron

3. Verify the error message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The patron should be created
2. The patron should be created
3. *PATRON_ACCOUNT_IDENTITY_PROVIDER_EXTERNAL_ID_ALREADY_EXISTS**The patron account cannot be created because the account identity provider external ID for the patron account already exists.*

Success

Expected Result:

Success

Success

Success

Success

title: Verify that the patron accesscode doenot having update permission then the gender field cannot be updated
custom_steps:
1. Prerequisite:
1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to Org admin
3. Select an access code and remove teh 
update permission.
4.Navigate to AFP
5.Select Patron Permissions
6.Select the new patron permission named 
Patron Contact Gender.
7.Set the option as Display/Required r 
Display/Optional.
8. Create a new patron with the access code 
which doesnot have update permission.
Expected Result:
Prerequisite should be met
2. Launch PV link and login
Expected Result:
Login shoud be successful
3. Select the patron menioned in prerequiste.
Expected Result:
The patron details should get displayed
4. Verify that the patron's gender field is not editable.
Expected Result:
The gender value shall also be governed by existing access code behavior.  Thus if a user does not have update 
permission to the patron contact entity, they shall not be able to change the gender value.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Prerequisite:
1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to Org admin
3. Select an access code and remove teh 
update permission.
4.Navigate to AFP
5.Select Patron Permissions
6.Select the new patron permission named 
Patron Contact Gender.
7.Set the option as Display/Required r 
Display/Optional.
8. Create a new patron with the access code 
which doesnot have update permission.
2. Launch PV link and login
3. Select the patron menioned in prerequiste.
4. Verify that the patron's gender field is not editable.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Prerequisite should be met
2. Login shoud be successful
3. The patron details should get displayed
4. The gender value shall also be governed by existing access code behavior.  Thus if a user does not have update 
permission to the patron contact entity, they shall not be able to change the gender value.

title: Verify the behavior of Patron Contact Gender AFP when it is set to Do Not Display
custom_steps:
1. Launch the PV link and login
Expected Result:
Login to PV application should be successful
2. Select System setup-> application feature permission
Expected Result:
Application Feature permissions page should load successfully
3. Set the levels and from drop down select patron 
permission
Expected Result:
The patron permissions should get listed successfully
4. Set the patorn contact gender as Do not display
Expected Result:
The permission setting should be successful
5. Navigate to patron management
Expected Result:
Patron management page should get 
displayed
6. Click on the new button to create a new patron
Expected Result:
Patron creation page should get displayed
7. Verify that the Gender attribute is not available in 
Patron Contact Creation page
Expected Result:
The Gender attribute should not be available 
in Patron Contact Creation page

? Do Not Display = field does not appear in the 
patron contact forms
o This option shall be the default value for the 
permission.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the PV link and login
2. Select System setup-> application feature permission
3. Set the levels and from drop down select patron 
permission
4. Set the patorn contact gender as Do not display
5. Navigate to patron management
6. Click on the new button to create a new patron
7. Verify that the Gender attribute is not available in 
Patron Contact Creation page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login to PV application should be successful
2. Application Feature permissions page should load successfully
3. The patron permissions should get listed successfully
4. The permission setting should be successful
5. Patron management page should get 
displayed
6. Patron creation page should get displayed
7. The Gender attribute should not be available 
in Patron Contact Creation page

? Do Not Display = field does not appear in the 
patron contact forms
o This option shall be the default value for the 
permission.

title: Verify the Simple Patron Form in Ticket Sales while updating a patron when the AFP is set to Required or Display
custom_steps:
1. 1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to system setup > AFP 
3.Select Patron permission
4.Set Permission for ?Patron Contact Date of 
Birth? as Required /Display 
5.Logout from Pv application and Login again
Expected Result:
Pre-requisite should be set
2. Login to PV
Expected Result:
User is able to login to PV successfully
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales
Search for a patron
Expected Result:
Simple Patron form is getting displayed
4. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
Expected Result:
Date of Birth field should be displayed
5. Verify that the user is unable to update a patron 
successfully if the Date of Birth field is kept as 
blank
Expected Result:
The patron should NOT be updated successfully 
if the Date of Birth field is blank and an error 
message should be displayed since it is a 
required field
6. In sales permission under AFP, set full patron management as true.
Go to Ticket sales>Financial Patron>New
Expected Result:
Full patron form is displayed
7. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
Expected Result:
Date of Birth field should be displayed.
8. Verify that the user is unable to update the 
patron successfully if the Date of Birth field is 
kept as blank
Expected Result:
The patron should NOT be updated successfully 
if the Date of Birth field is blank and an error 
message should be displayed since it is a 
required field

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to system setup > AFP 
3.Select Patron permission
4.Set Permission for ?Patron Contact Date of 
Birth? as Required /Display 
5.Logout from Pv application and Login again
2. Login to PV
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales
Search for a patron
4. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
5. Verify that the user is unable to update a patron 
successfully if the Date of Birth field is kept as 
blank
6. In sales permission under AFP, set full patron management as true.
Go to Ticket sales>Financial Patron>New
7. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
8. Verify that the user is unable to update the 
patron successfully if the Date of Birth field is 
kept as blank
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requisite should be set

3. Simple Patron form is getting displayed
4. Date of Birth field should be displayed
5. The patron should NOT be updated successfully 
if the Date of Birth field is blank and an error 
message should be displayed since it is a 
required field
6. Full patron form is displayed
7. Date of Birth field should be displayed.
8. The patron should NOT be updated successfully 
if the Date of Birth field is blank and an error 
message should be displayed since it is a 
required field

1. 1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to system setup > AFP 
3.Select Patron permission
4.Set Permission for ?Patron Contact Date of 
Birth as Optional/Display
5.Logout from Pv application and Login again
Expected Result:
Pre-requisite should be set
2. Login to PV
Expected Result:
User is able to login to PV successfully
3. Nvaigate to Ticket Sales
Search for a patron
Expected Result:
Simple Patron form should be displayed
4. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
Expected Result:
Date of Birth field should be displayed
User should be able to save the patron details 
even if the date of birth filed is blank
5. In sales permission under AFP, set full patron management as true.
Go to Ticket sales>Financial Patron>New
Expected Result:
Full patron form is displayed
6. Verify that the user is able update the patron 
successfully even if the Date of Birth field is 
kept as blank
Expected Result:
The  user should be able create the patron successfully even if the Date of Birth field is kept as blank
7. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
Expected Result:
Date of Birth field should be displayed.
8. Verify that the user is able update the patron 
successfully even if the Date of Birth field is 
kept as blank
Expected Result:
Date of Birth field should be displayed
User should be able to save the patron details 
even if the date of birth filed is blank

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to system setup > AFP 
3.Select Patron permission
4.Set Permission for ?Patron Contact Date of 
Birth as Optional/Display
5.Logout from Pv application and Login again
2. Login to PV
3. Nvaigate to Ticket Sales
Search for a patron
4. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
5. In sales permission under AFP, set full patron management as true.
Go to Ticket sales>Financial Patron>New
6. Verify that the user is able update the patron 
successfully even if the Date of Birth field is 
kept as blank
7. Verify whether Date of Birth field is displayed.
8. Verify that the user is able update the patron 
successfully even if the Date of Birth field is 
kept as blank
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requisite should be set
2. User is able to login to PV successfully
3. Simple Patron form should be displayed
4. Date of Birth field should be displayed
User should be able to save the patron details 
even if the date of birth filed is blank
5. Full patron form is displayed
6. The  user should be able create the patron successfully even if the Date of Birth field is kept as blank
7. Date of Birth field should be displayed.
8. Date of Birth field should be displayed
User should be able to save the patron details 
even if the date of birth filed is blank

title: Verify whether the proper message are written to the database and PVHC logs when a new patron account is added  when property is set to True.
custom_steps:
1. Pre-requisite:
1.Set property 
"patron.util.PatronAccountMsgCreator.create.message"  to true.(DEFAULT:True)
Expected Result:
Pre-requisites should be met
2. Launch PV application
Expected Result:
Application should be launched successfully.
3. Go to Patron Management
Expected Result:
Patron search page should be shown
4. Create new patron and apply changes
Expected Result:
New patron is created successfully.
5. Verify whether the changes are saved successfully,
Expected Result:
Changes should be saved successfully.
6. Verify whether the values are passed in the PVHC logs as expected.
Expected Result:
Proper ids should be passed in the logs
7. Verify the DB details
Expected Result:
Values should be updated in the DB
8. Verify whether the proper message are pwritten 
to the database
Expected Result:
proper message should be written to the 
database

title: Verify whether  Merge as target value is correctly displayed and is able to change the value if patron does have the AFP permission to change it.
custom_steps:
1. Prerequisites:
 
Set the Merge as target value as user A, that has 
access Can Update 'Merge As Target Only' 
Status - true

Can Update 'Merge As Target Only' Status - true
Expected Result:
All prerequisites are set.
2. Login to PV as user A
Expected Result:
User is able to login successfully
3. Perform patron management on a patron by 
setting his/her Merge As Target Only field.
Expected Result:
User is able to Perform patron management 
on a patron by setting his/her Merge As 
Target Only field.
4. Login as Patron B
Go to patron management of the same patron 
and verify the value of Merge As Target Only.
Expected Result:
Patron B is able to see the updated 
value(updated by patron A) for Merge as target 
only field.
5. Verfiy whether user B is able to edit the value.
Expected Result:
The checkbox is selectable for patron B
6. Modify the value.
Login as Patron A and verify the Merge as target only for the same.
Expected Result:
Patron A can view the changes made by patron B in editable mode.

access Can Update 'Merge As Target Only' 
Status - true
Set the Merge as target value as user B, that has 
Can Update 'Merge As Target Only' Status - true

setting his/her Merge As Target Only field.
4. Login as Patron B

and verify the value of Merge As Target Only.
5. Verfiy whether user B is able to edit the value.
6. Modify the value.

2. User is able to login successfully
3. User is able to Perform patron management 
on a patron by setting his/her Merge As 
Target Only field.

value(updated by patron A) for Merge as target 
only field.

6. Patron A can view the changes made by patron B in editable mode.

title: Verify that PV returns an error if the email address has a space and the email address domain is not like @unknown.com
custom_steps:

2. Navigate to Patron Management and Click New.
Expected Result:
Page to enter new details should be displayed.
3. 1. Enter all mandatory details.
2. Enter email address with domain not in a 
format  "@unknown.com" and put a space just before @ 
symbol(e.g: abcd @sfdsf )
3. Click Apply Changes.
Expected Result:
Error message should be dispalyed.
4. Verify that PV returns an error if the email address has a space 
and the email address domain is not like @unknown.com
Expected Result:

address domain is "@unknown.com",  PV should 
return "invalid email address" error.
